7fd7651a8ca9108dbde4919c088cceff (12:11): but i am beginer

679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (12:14): check your main function :D

7fd7651a8ca9108dbde4919c088cceff (12:32): shite ! OK

7fd7651a8ca9108dbde4919c088cceff (12:33): [Peter]: why remove Ui::XXXX  ???  is suggested ??
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (12:33): LinuxadminA: because you already have them in the ImageDialog ctor
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (12:34): LinuxadminA: and your connect to the checkValues slot is done with the instance in that ctor
7fd7651a8ca9108dbde4919c088cceff (12:34): [Peter]: oooo ~~~~ i see
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (12:34): when you do it again in the main function you just replace the current set of widgets and your connection is lost

e4861610d329149fea4f7bfe65b0ab4f (13:00): KDE-apps allows uploads of <=750 KB. Why is this? How do I overcome this obstacle?
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:05): me playing with layouts
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:05): i have one QHBoxLayout and only one button i have added to the layout
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:05): its stretching for the whole widget :(
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:06): i also tried setting its stretch factor, but nothing is helpine me aroung...
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (13:06): add a spacer to the layout :-)
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (13:06): or if you want the button centered add two
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:06): well, am not using Qt Designer :(
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (13:07): that's ok - you can add them through code.... just trying to remember what the code is...
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:08): skyphyr, i think its addStretch function, i think am arriving with the result :)
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (13:09): ahhh that sounds familiar
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:09): now, this is working, but its placing my button on the right hand corner!
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (13:10): did you set the direction?
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:11): will set now to Left to Right
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (13:13): where did you want the button?
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:13): i have no clue, but if i go on adding buttons, its starting from right
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:14): ok, is QHBoxLayout start from right to left?
8a9822ff0595044d78204c7678d53294 (13:14): I thought it was local specific - in places where the language is written left to right it's left to right and the reverse also
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:15): ah...i dont think so skyphyr
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:17): k, reversing the direction helped me
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:17): i set the direction from right to left and its working
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (13:21): Chaks: if you don't want the widgets to fill all the avilable space, use QLayout::addStretch
8cd92d71303e1807c7ac01959683e244 (13:22): Peter, yes, that worked :)
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (13:22): lol, I wasn't at the end of my scrollback
679d1040f9b6906a2e8e6f9cf083f7be (13:22): didn't see you already solved it :D
